chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zakiya Shante Collins appeared by video.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Zakiya Shante Collins.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requested plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 16; IN PERSON.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Zakiya Shante Collins in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state, but requests additional time to speak with client. Court grants request and adjourns matter for a Status Conference, and sets 08/22/2022 deadline for filing any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-29-22

Defendant Zakiya Shante Collins in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-11-2022
Attorney William Rakestraw received and filed

Defendant Zakiya Shante Collins in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 4-5-2022

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Zakiya Shante Collins in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Zakiya Shante Collins in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
